/self.description: This holds the key (MMSI or other unique ID) of this vessel, the actual data is in the vessels array.

/vessels/(^urn:mrn:(imo|signalk):(mmsi:[.description: A location of a resource, potentially relative. For hierarchical schemes (like http), applications must resolve relative URIs (e.g. './v1/api/'). Implementations should support the following schemes: http:, https:, mailto:, tel:, and ws:.
Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI). Has to be 9 digits. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maritime_Mobile_Service_Identity for information.

A unique Signal K flavoured maritime resource identifier (MRN). A MRN is a form of URN, following a specific format: urn:mrn:<issueing authority>:<id type>:<id>. In case of a Signal K uuid, that looks like this: urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:<uuid>, where Signal K is the issuing authority and UUID (v4) the ID type.

Schema describing the navigation child-object of a Vessel.
/vessels/(^urn:mrn:(imo|signalk):(mmsi:[.title: navigation

course.title: Course
course.description: The currently active course (can be a route, or just a point one is navigating towards)

crossTrackError.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).

bearingTrackTrue.description: The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.

bearingTrackMagnetic.description: The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.

href.description: A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.

estimatedTimeOfArrival.description: The estimated time of arrival at the end of the current route

startTime.description: The time this route was activated

nextPoint.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating towards

type.description: The type of the next point (e.g. Waypoint, POI, Race Mark, etc)

href.description: A reference (URL) to an object (under resources) this point is related to

distance.description: The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint

bearingTrue.description: The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north

bearingMagnetic.description: The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north

velocityMadeGood.description: The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint

timeToGo.description: Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular) with current speed & direction

position.description: The position of nextPoint in two dimensions

previousPoint.description: The point on earth the vessel's presently navigating from

type.description: The type of the previous point (e.g. Waypoint, POI, Race Mark, etc)

distance.description: The distance in meters between previousPoint and the vessel's present position

position.description: The position of lastPoint in two dimensions

m/s2.description: Acceleration in meters per second squared

Pa/s.description: Pressure change rate in pascal per second

mmsi.description: Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI). Has to be 9 digits. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maritime_Mobile_Service_Identity for information.

uuid.description: A unique Signal K flavoured maritime resource identifier (MRN). A MRN is a form of URN, following a specific format: urn:mrn:<issueing authority>:<id type>:<id>. In case of a Signal K uuid, that looks like this: urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:<uuid>, where Signal K is the issuing authority and UUID (v4) the ID type.

url.description: A location of a resource, potentially relative. For hierarchical schemes (like http), applications must resolve relative URIs (e.g. './v1/api/'). Implementations should support the following schemes: http:, https:, mailto:, tel:, and ws:.

stringValue.description: Data should be of type number.

nullValue.description: Data should be of type NULL.

units.title: units schema.
units.description: The (derived) SI unit of this value.

timeout.title: Timeout

alertMethod.title: Alert Method
alertMethod.description: The method to use to raise the alert. An alert is an event that should be known

warnMethod.title: Warn Method
warnMethod.description: The method to use to raise the warning. A warning is an unexpected event that may require attention

alarmMethod.title: Alarm Method
alarmMethod.description: The method to use to raise the alarm. An alarm requires immediate attention, eg no oil pressure

emergencyMethod.title: Emergency Method
emergencyMethod.description: The method to use to raise an emergency. An emergency is an immediate danger to life or vessel

zones.description: The zones defining the range of values for this signalk value.

Schema describing the performance child-object of a Vessel.
/vessels/(^urn:mrn:(imo|signalk):(mmsi:[.title: performance

polarSpeed.description: The current polar speed based on current polar diagram, trueWindSpeed and truewindAngle.

polarSpeedRatio.description: The ratio of current speed through water to the polar speed.

velocityMadeGood.description: The current velocity made good derived from the speed through water and appearant wind angle. A positive value is heading to upwind, negative to downwind.

velocityMadeGoodToWaypoint.description: The current velocity made good to the next waypoint derived from the speedOverGround, courseOverGround.

beatAngle.description: The true wind beat angle for the best velocity made good based on current current polar diagram and trueWindSpeed.

beatAngleVelocityMadeGood.description: The velocity made good for the beat angle.

beatAngleTargetSpeed.description: The target speed for the beat angle.

gybeAngle.description: The true wind gybe angle for the best velocity made good downwind based on current polar diagram and trueWindSpeed.

gybeAngleVelocityMadeGood.description: The velocity made good for the gybe angle

gybeAngleTargetSpeed.description: The target speed for the gybe angle.

targetAngle.description: The true wind gybe or beat angle for the best velocity made good downwind or upwind based on current polar diagram and trueWindSpeed.

targetSpeed.description: The target speed for the beat angle or gybe angle, which ever is applicable.
